g.text: UMA wide ecosystem - Bob from Alice (pull data) with DKIM signed claims
If Bob uses an email provider (outlook) that does not support webfinger,
he must set up his mailbox to automatically forward emails sent
Claims Provider can send email messages from addresses challenge@bar.com and retrieve from response@bar.com
RqP Client is registered at bar.com AuthN server and pre-registered as a universal AEMS public client at foo.com AuthZ server
foo.com Admin has set up the Resource Server and registers it's resource set
'Incoming' and 'Outgoing' with the foo.com AuthZ server with the associated scopes:
Claims Provider publishes its metadata on a URL https:
Claims Provider is registered at Bob's AuthN server and is assigned 'query-users', 'view-user' admin role
Bob's email_address is in access_token returned at step 3. a)
The email_address is determined by RqP Client
Claims Provider is assigned the 'query-users, view-users' admin role, thus can query and view any user to get their claims
Use Bob's email_address extracted from access_token from a request at step 5. a)
Use Bob's email_address extracted from a request body at step 5. b)
10. Send plain_message from challenge@bar.com to bob@outlook.com
11. Retrieve dkim_signed_message sent from bob@outlook.com to response@bar.com
if the payload is large, consider using PCT (see UMA specs. for details)
In addition to claims_token, pushed claims may also contain metadata such as:
2. file_info (filename, file size, file digest, mime type)
3. bootstrup discovery of Claims Provider config url via Webfinger, if it doesn't work
build well-known url using domain part of email_address
8. evaluate other optional claims e.g. recipient_info, file_info
3. extract 'From:' part of dkim_signed_message e.g. Bob Sanders <bob@outlook.com>
4. extract claims_provider_configuration_url and ticket_challenge from dkim_signed_message
9. evaluate other optional claims e.g. recipient_info, file_info
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
[RqP Client uses Authorization Code Grant - Bob is involved]
[RqP Client uses Client Credential Grant - Bob is not involved]
[Get Claims - Bob was involved at step 3. a)]
[Get Claims - Bob was not involved at step 3. b)]
[Prepare email_address - Bob was involved at step 3. a)]
[Prepare email_address - Bob was not involved at step 3. b)]
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
[Domain part of email_address or Webfinger is used to locate Claims Provider configuration url]
[Bob has to demonstrate control of his mailbox]
